item.title: Shardwalker
item.description: Shardwalker An occupation focused on the discovery and extraction of Gems to replenish stockpiles and reserves.

item.title: Modernization
item.description: Modernization The discoveries of the Renaissance launched civilization into a new era littered with new creations based on hardlight.

item.title: Labradorite
item.description: Labradorite Labradorite allows for the manipulation of light as its Intrinsic Power making it incredibly versatile with applications ranging from simple lighting fixtures, to “digital” displays, to twisting light into optical illusions.

item.title: Intrinsic Power
item.description: Intrinsic Power In addition to a Gem’s raw energy, each gem of a specific type can harness a specific power.

item.title: Bismuth
item.description: Bismuth Bismuth is prized for its Intrinsic Power of morphing physical matter and is responsible for much of the non-hardlight constructions in the Modern era.

item.title: Sapphire
item.description: Sapphire Sapphire’s Intrinsic Power grants its users accelerated thought processing allowing them to conclude the best possible scenario despite hundreds of variables.

item.title: Ruby
item.description: Ruby The Intrinsic Power of rubies grants enhanced reflexes allowing its users to move far before they register a threat.

item.title: Emerald
item.description: Emerald Emerald has the Intrinsic Power of healing but is not quite a miracle worker.

item.title: Crystallization
item.description: Crystallization The phenomena of matter being converted into Gems when the incurred Strain exceeds Resilience.

item.title: Renaissance
item.description: Renaissance Runeographers largely avoided applying Gem energy to organic matter due to the threat of Crystallization, but the gem families seeking to expand their influence would pressure their sponsored runeographers & Inscriptionists into beginning experiments leveraging the control they gaine...
